- Yeah, I'm really excited

about the work we've
done with Magellan TV.

Now, Magellan is a customer
that is very similar to Netflix,
but they do documentaries.

And they were looking
to go internationally,

which means that there's
a need for translations.
And also, if you think about, it's video,

so they've gotta do dubbing
of audio over video as well.

And there's some inherent
challenges with that.

So, not only do they need to
have quality translations,
they also need to have,

when you're doing the dubbing,
you wanna make sure that

the audio is overlaying
nicely with the video.

And they've also gotta
be able to replicate it
in multiple languages.
So, we were able to work with them

and utilize technologies like
Poly, Translate, Bedrock,

Titan, all of those to help
create a solution for them

that was able to do things
like, not just the translations,
but take it even deeper.
If you think about idioms,

where some, we might use
the term like "I hustle,"
and it was first translated,
I don't remember the exact translation,
but it was something like, I'm lazy,
which is not

what you want, right-
- [Erin] Mm-hmm.

So, we were able to use the
idiom detector to translate that
to "I work hard."
So, it's much more accurate.
So, that's one piece of it.
And then, another piece of it is,

if you think about the
length of a sentence.

So if a sentence in English
that's maybe 10 words,

in German, could maybe be
15 or 16, or whatever words
so much longer.
And that creates a problem with video.

So, you want to be able
to translate that sentence
and shorten it, but still maintain
the quality of the translation
and the integrity of the translation.
So, we were able to work with them
and their initial cost for the dubbing
was $18 per minute.

We were able to get it down
